body_html:
Hi @jhseu,

Then you just solved one of these problems. Please take a look at #15302

Instead of adding

#include "tensorflow/core/platform/cpu_info.h"

I could do

#if defined(PLATFORM_WINDOWS)
#include "tensorflow/core/platform/windows/cpu_info.h"
#endif

Then __BYTE_ORDER__ will remain undefined if PLATFORM_WINDOWS is not defined (because of lacking tf_copts)
However, we have code like
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/framework/numeric_types.h#L55

#if __BYTE_ORDER__ == __ORDER_BIG_ENDIAN__
    value = p[0];
#else
    value = p[1];
#endif

Who includes this file will get a silent error.

Then __BYTE_ORDER__  will remain undefined if PLATFORM_WINDOWS is not defined (because of lacking tf_copts)
However, we have code like
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/framework/numeric_types.h#L55
#if __BYTE_ORDER__ == __ORDER_BIG_ENDIAN__
    value = p[0];
#else

#endif

Who includes this file will get a silent error.
body:
Hi @jhseu,

Then you just solved one of these problems.  Please take a look at #15302

Instead of adding
```
#include "tensorflow/core/platform/cpu_info.h"
```
I could do 
```
#if defined(PLATFORM_WINDOWS)
#include "tensorflow/core/platform/windows/cpu_info.h"
#endif
```

Then \_\_BYTE_ORDER\_\_  will remain undefined if PLATFORM_WINDOWS is not defined (because of lacking tf_copts)
However, we have code like
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/framework/numeric_types.h#L55
```
#if __BYTE_ORDER__ == __ORDER_BIG_ENDIAN__
    value = p[0];
#else
    value = p[1];
#endif
```

Who includes this file will get a silent error.
